document_data.name: Sreve
document_data.mainbody: '''Sreve''' was a village of shepherds and root-farmers in the 9{{th}} and 10{{th}} century [[DR]]. It was the native village of the [[Magister]] [[Kurtal]].

Geography.Geographical Features: Kurtal had a mill, a main street, and a ridge to the east where a mage's tower, originally belonging to [[Justal Iroon]], stood. The mill had a millpond.
Geography.Flora & Fauna: Fish lived in the millpond. The villagers were mostly shepherders and root-farmers.

document_data.History:
At some point prior to {{yearlink|797}}, [[Radellus]] came to Sreve to take [[Justal Iroon]]'s tower, and after a fierce battle, he prevailed. Radellus was later defeated by Kurtal, who froze some of the rubble falling from the tower in time to serve as a warning to the villagers.

Sreve was destroyed during [[Kurtal]]'s tenure as the [[Magister]], due to the number of duels with his challengers that took the fighting there. The town had been reduced to nothing by the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Notable Locations: The tower of [[Justal Iroon]] was close to Sreve, and so was [[Kurtal]]'s abode.
